00025 class EncodingThreadlet : public Threadlet {
00026     typedef Threadlet Base;
00027     
00028     public: 
00029         virtual ~EncodingThreadlet();
00030 
00035         virtual void ReleaseInstance(); 
00036 
00038         virtual INT Fn();
00039 
00040     protected:
00044         EncodingThreadlet(ImageEncoder& encoder, const Image& source, DataSink& dest);
00045 
00050         EncodingThreadlet(ImageEncoder& encoder,
00051                           BinData& source,
00052                           const Image::MetaData& src_params,
00053                           DataSink& dest);
00054 
00056         ImageEncoder& GetEncoder() { return m_encoder; }
00057 
00058         // Returns the source image. 0 is returned if a binary data as source is used.
00059         const Image* GetImage() const { return m_src_image; }
00060 
00062         BinData* GetBinData() const { return m_src_data; }
00063         
00065         const Image::MetaData* GetMetaData() const { return m_src_params; }
00066 
00068         DataSink& GetDataSink() { return m_data_sink; }
00069         
00070     private:
00071         // References instead of pointers are used, as it may never be allowed to change
00072         // the properties during the lifetime of the instance and also because the
00073         // properties never may be 0.
00074         ImageEncoder& m_encoder;
00075         DataSink& m_data_sink;
00076 
00077         BinData* m_src_data;
